title: Added extra crate with the FpsLimit plugin
fix `game_15_puzzle` example to generate valid arrangements
body:
fixes #124.

To generate solvable arrangement, I simply move randomly from an initial board.
There will be some other methods, but I think this is straightforward.

title: Improve how the screen_to_local and local_to_screen works for the Draw2d API
body:
* [x] Draw global `screen_to_world`
* [x] Draw global `world_to_screen`
* [x] Draw object `screen_to_local`
* [x] Draw object `local_to_screen`

title: Added an option to enable or disable High DPI
Replace crevice by glsl-layout to allow array types
add missing `#[cfg(feature = "log")]`
Added std140 uniform helpers
Improved how the Uniform buffer data upload data tot he gpu
body:
* _Breaking change_
* Glam types can be used uniforms directly
* Added the macro `uniform` to define structs that are serialized as std140 automatically

title: window can be hidden or displayer now setting the visible attr
Added ' texture_to_file' feature to save as png textures or render textures
body:
This PR adds `Texture::to_file` and `RenderTexture::to_file` to export as png the content of the textures. 
It also adds some debug checks to warn the user when do something silly with Graphics that it can cause undefined behavior.

title: Added capture cursor feature to lock the cursor inside the window's app
body:
* added `Window::set_capture_cursor` and `Window::capture_cursor` to confine the cursor into the window's app
* Added `app.mouse.wheel_delta` to read the delta without check the event loop

title: Fixed EGUI 0.18.1 Paint callback feature
body:
* Fixed viewport issues where the Y axis was inverted and wasn't using DPI to calculate min positon
* fixed #93

title: Removed chrono due a security issue
body:
Fixes https://github.com/Nazariglez/notan/security/dependabot/1

Also logs now uses UTC time and the format is always `[year]-[month]-[day] [hour]:[minutes]:[days]`

title: Fixed and improved some low level rendering code
body:
- VAOs doesn't keep older attribute pointers anymore after a new VAO is bind
- Textures can use Wrap modes now
- Increased textures slots per shader from 8 to 16
- Deprecated `math::DEG_TO_RAD` and `math::RAD_TO_DEG`
- Textures need to be declared on the pipeline with the location ID

title: Add touch support
Egui 0.18.1 Support
Added core and input crates to have the code more organised
v0.3.0
body:
* Updated dependencies
* Added mouse and keyboard types to the prelude4
* Audio Support using Oddio

title: Audio Support
Rebase main
Rebase develop
v0.2.1 - Fix: Egui does not repaints after resize the window
v0.2.0 Better EGUI integration and a bunch of fixes/improvements
body:
The main focus for the 0.2.0 version was to improve the integration of the `egui` crate with Notan, along with some improvements and fixes:

* Updated all dependencies to the latest version available
* Migrated from 2018 edition to 2021
* Added drag and drop file support
* Added custom mouse cursors support
* Added browser links support
* Added lazy loop mode
* Added `sRGB` texture support
* Added `Lines` and `LineStrip` primitives
* Added new examples and improved the main page
* Added support for premultiplied alpha images
* Re-exported `glam` types as part of `notan_math`
* Renamed `VertexFormat` to more explicit names
* Improved the API used to call `egui` code.
* Other minor fixes and changes...

title: Added support for custom cursors
Added a lazy_loop mode
body: This PR adds an option to stop the thread or the execution loop until an input event arrives. Quite useful for apps, to avoid consuming CPU when there is nothing to render or process.

title: Improved EGUI support
Improve example webpage
Added support for Drop Files using web and native backends
prepare to publish
Better support for glyphs between different modules
Added support for Instancing rendering
body: This PR contains a breaking change, the `VertexBuffer`, `IndexBuffer` and `UniformBuffer` were removed in favour of `Buffer`. This allows uploading the buffer data when the buffer really changes and not on each pass and removes one `RwLock`. There is a little improvement in performance which is always nice.

title: Buffers are now more efficient
Minor API improvements
Improved assets / resources code + some examples
Game & Misc examples
Wasm32 Code clean up
Improved math crate
Added FpsPlugin to set a maximum frame rate target.
body:
The plugin is part of the app crate and is loaded in the prelude. To use it we only need to add it. 

```rust
#[notan_main]
fn main() -> Result<(), String> {
    notan::init()
        .add_plugin(FpsPlugin::new(60))
        .draw(draw)
        .build()
}
```

Close #56

title: Added a simple Atlas parser
body: Only AABB, rotations are not supported because that involves using matrices and I don't want to add more info to the Texture object for now.

title: Fix #60. Egui Looks better now, also added a new API to read pixels from a texture uploaded to the GPU
Egui can use now textures from notan
Fixed different issues related to the device pixel ratio and added an option to manage this automatically
EGUI Implementation (Basic)
body:
This PR allows to use EGUI as a  plugin. 

Still need some work to support the clipboard, files, and improve how it looks on browsers. But they will be added in different PRs.

title: Ergonomic Graphic API and Glyphs and Draw2d decoupled (among another things)
body: This PR is a huge refactor to provide a better graphics API based on the build pattern, keeping graphic related packages as standalone packages, introducing the concept of graphic extensions (Draw been the first one) (using hecs internally), etc...

title: Feature pairing with old code
body:
The core has the same features as the old code.

However, atlas, animations and tweens are not ported yet, I'm still not sure if worth it or not, because the level of this framework should remain low-level, so these features are going to be external plugins probably. 

Some examples need to be ported yet, like the games.

title: Rework is not an experiment anymore
Desktop support using winit and glutin
Integrated the Glyphs API as crate to be used as standalone with the graphics API and into the Draw2D API
Added a new API to draw 2d
body: I need to finish the handlers for the draw callbacks and add a new API to draw text, but all of that can be done in this branch.

title: Improved the drawing API
Improved how the asset load works
Added post process example
added some utils to calculate world to local and local to world coordinates
added a tween manager just for convenience
Added a new module to create tweens and interpolations
removed extra module
Minor fixes and changes
Fixed high DPI resolution for draw2d
improved atlas support
Improved how the resources are loaded
Remove old crate nae-glow in favour of nae-gfx (which also uses glow internally)
Added a new module to draw 3d and 2d easily
Added a new low-level graphics API based on glow.rs
Unified web, sdl2 and winit backend in just one crate
SDL2 Backend
body: This PR adds a new backend based on Sdl2

title: New animation helper
body: This PR adds a new object that represents an animation ready to be drawn with the context2d.

title: Fix the shader version for OpenGL ES 2.0
body: This PR changes the shader version for mobile devices using OpenGL ES 2.0 from `GLSL 300 es` to `GLSL 100`.

title: Added a helper that scale matrices to fit/fill containers (Useful to screen scaling)
body: This PR adds as extra a helper that scale matrices filling a container size. This is useful work with a fixed screen size no matter the size of the window.

title: Improve the performance and the support for the geometry object
body:
This PR improves the geometry object by removing the build method because it wasn't needed. 
The vertices are now calculated at the time that the user stroke or fill the geometries.

I also added some examples and comments.

title: Errors on the main run function will send the error to the upper scope
body: This PR exposes the error of the run function to the sup scope. This is useful on a web backend where some of the events can fail before the program starts. For the winit backend this is not important because the thread will be blocked once the event loop starts never reaching the return.
